title: How to Make Rasam

steps.headline: Cook toor dal: Take half cup toor dal in a pan and add 1.5 cups of water to it.
steps.description: Put it in a pressure cooker and let the steam come out of the spout. Once the steam comes, add the weight and after 3 whistles, remove it from the flame.

steps.headline: Make Rasam: Take a deep bottomed pan and add 3 cups of water.
steps.description: Add about 2 tablespoons of tamarind paste to it. Add a teaspoon of salt, a pinch of turmeric and 2 teaspoons of rasam powder. Dice 2 tomatoes and add it to the pot.

steps.headline: Mix well and let boil.
steps.description: After about 10 minutes of boiling add the cooked toor dal to the mixture and let it boil for another 5 minutes. The mixture should be watery.

steps.headline: Add more water if needed.
steps.description: Add salt if needed. After boiling, add finely chopped coriander and curry leaves.Add a small teaspoon of ghee or butter to the mixture.

steps.headline: Fry the spices:Take a pan add some oil and add mustard and red chilli to crackle and pour it to the  boiled rasam.
Serve piping hot with rice or drink out of a bowl.
